Create to-do to perform review for all IMB admins.

Create to-do to perform review for all IMB admins.

comments.comment: This is where everyone will see who chose what future workflow.  Logic is we take the answers from the IMB, EC and Issue Owner.  If any Yes, then the workflow is required.  If all agree NO, then the workflow does not get populated.  This workflow is displayed in the Result field.
comments.name: issue_level_workflow_IMB

comments.comment: Scenario 1: IMB or EC requires the process. Result: show the chevron as required.
comments.name: issue_level_workflow_complete

comments.comment: Scenario 1B: CA is not required by Topic or by any other entity. We still need to collect Cause Codes / Apparent causes. Result: show the chevron for CA with only 1 step to collect cause codes.
comments.name: issue_level_workflow_complete

comments.comment: Scenario 2: No one requires the process, Issue Owner does not intent to do the process. Result: do not show chevron
comments.name: issue_level_workflow_complete

comments.comment: Scenario 3: System requires the process based on Issue Tier (robust etc), IMB says the process is not required. Result: Optional - IMB or EC can override Topic
comments.name: issue_level_workflow_complete

comments.comment: Scenario 4: System, IMB, and EC say process is not required, Issue Owner says they want to do the process anyway. Result: show the optional chevron
comments.name: issue_level_workflow_complete

extra fields on the UCN 26407 that we may or may not need:
Describe the evidence of completion - is the goal here to record the evidence in the form? if so the evidence is recorded in the closure evidence chevron and not needed here. If the intent is something else then

comments.comment:
Is this question not the main purpose of the approval? Could it be merged with approval decision?

If can not be merged, if you answer No does that mean user must reject below, or can the action still be approved?

comments.comment: Only the Issue Owner would be able to cancel an action? Can you cancel it after CAP approval?

comments.comment: Justification may not be needed if the object is being closed because of a routine process, like System Closure. It would be needed if a user is closing it instead of completing all the workflow.

comments.comment: Issue owner would submit. Cant submit until both CA and EOC are completed. If EOC is incomplete can use the overflow menu to submit Conditional Approval

comments.comment: Once all CNS approvals are done - notify all action owners that they have an action to work. NPO approvals may still be outstanding but that is ok
comments.name: issues_CAP_approval_approverView

comments.comment: test comment
comments.name: issues_CAP_approval_approverView

comments.comment: Once all approvals are completed send a notification to each action owner telling them that their action is approved and ready to work. This will be the second notification they receive about their action - the first will be sent after the action is dispositioned by the Issue Owner.
comments.name: issues_CAP_status

comments.comment:
If possible, Topic would run a nightly job to determine if all the actions under this is are completed and then trigger the next step automatically - so Issue owner does not have to push this button. Pushing this button would simply move the workflow forward immediately rather than waiting for the nightly job.
If the nightly job run we would probably add a to-do for the Issue owner to fill out the prepare form in the Effectiveness Review (if required)
comments.name: issues_CAP_status

comments.comment: Field-level change request. If ER owner wants to change the scope they will need Issue Owner to approve the new scope
comments.name: issues_effectiveness_prepare

comments.comment: Any cause that was previously dispositioned (on the Action Plan chevron) by the Issue Owner as not being resolved will not show up here.
comments.name: issues_effectiveness_results

comments.comment: If ER owner indicated on the Results form that one of the causes was not resolved the Issue Owner could select NO here - and follow that process. Decision would be up to them.
comments.name: issues_effectiveness_approval

comments.comment: Since no is selected above, pushing this button would create Action Plan #2 and the Issue Owner would be responsible for creating new actions to resolve the causes.
comments.name: issues_effectiveness_approval_no

comments.comment: EC person is filling out this form, this is their last step in the Issue process.
comments.name: issues_effectiveness_ECReview

ops.insert: EC person is filling out this form, this is their last step in the Issue process.

comments.comment: NPO will only approve Issue types Finding, Management Concern, Weaknesses etc - they would NOT approve PP and Observation type issues. NPO would only approve issues where they are involved in the parent object (correspondence or Assessment)
comments.name: issues_close

comments.comment: NPO per Julieanne would like notifications on the closure of PP Issues where they do not approve, but observations no notification is needed.
comments.name: issues_close

comments.comment: Only NPO users can fill out this form
comments.name: issues_close_npoApproval

comments.comment: IMB and EC would need to approve the issue closure. NPO may also need to approve if the issue is from an NPO Correspondence or an NPO-shadowed assessment.
